intro: Linociera acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed linociera, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with acute tips. Its small, white flowers are clustered in axillary inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
